mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, George Washington to Saml. Powell, 1788 January 18
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Washington, George, 1732-1799
mdRecord.dcterms:description: No news [on adoption of Constitution] -- glad to hear Pennsylvania, New Jersey and Delaware have adopted proposed Constitution -- Connecticut, Massachusetts, and New Hampshire are next on the stage -- "Of the unanimity of Maryland there can be little question; - and tho' the Constitution in this state has powerful adversaries, little doubt of the adoption of it, has a place in my mind ..." North Carolina to postpone convention til after Virginia's, "which is indicative, in my opinion, of a disposition to take her tone from hence ..." -- of Georgia, "... if a weak state, with powerful tribes of Indians in its rear, and the Spaniards on its flank do not incline to embrace a strong general Government there must, I should think, be either wickedness, or insanity in their conduct." -- generosity of landholders in county of Philadelphia in proposing it for seat of Federal government. Autograph letter signed, 3 pages, docketed by S. Powel(?), watermark (C & I Honig). Name on original manuscri
